headline: Ricotta Gnocchi
description: This ricotta gnocchi recipe is worth the effort for cheesy dumplings everyone will love, smothered in a fresh tomato sauce and topped with mozzarella.

video.description: Old family recipe for authentic gnocchi!
video.name: Ricotta Gnocchi

name: Ricotta Gnocchi
recipeIngredient: 1 cup all-purpose flour, or as needed
8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, cut into small chunks

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the gnocchi: Stir together ricotta, eggs, Parmesan, salt, pepper, and garlic powder in a large bowl until evenly combined. Mix in 1 cup flour. Add additional flour if needed to form a soft dough.

Divide dough into 3 or 4 pieces and roll into 1/2-inch thick ropes on a floured surface. Cut each rope into 1-inch pieces and place on a lightly floured baking sheet. Place in the refrigerator until ready to use.

Make the sauce: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in garlic and cook until softened and fragrant, about 1 minute. Pour in diced tomatoes and red pepper flakes; bring to a simmer over medium-high heat and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in shredded basil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
While sauce is simmering, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Boil the gnocchi until they float to the surface, 1 to 2 minutes, then drain.
To assemble the dish: Stir cubed mozzarella into the sauce and allow the heat of the sauce to soften but not melt the cheese. Place gnocchi into a serving bowl and spoon sauce overtop.

review.reviewBody: This one is going in the recipe bible. I found it using the SuperCook recipe finder. It finds internet recipes that match what you have in the pantry. I assumed I had the mozzarella but did not. I had ricotta left in the tub so I layered small spoonfuls in the center and on top then baked it. It was so easy and highlighted tomatoes from the garden.

Very easy and good. I made a double batch so we could eat some today and I will freeze the rest. I only use one egg, even for the double batch. I used real garlic. Another difference is that I have a large plastic tray that fits in my fridge. I dusted it with about 1/2 - 3/4 cup of semolina. I put the formed gnocchi on there and shook it a little, and rested them in the semolina for about 2-3 hours. The semolina and resting helps them firm up a wee bit, and for me, it made it easier to put the fork marks in and the grooves stayed present much better after boiling. I got the semolina idea from Epicurious. These need more towards 4-5 minutes boiling, not just 1-2, or they taste of raw flour. I made my own sauce - also a biggish batch. Now I will have 2 person portion sizes of sauce and gnocchi in the freezer for future meals when I don't really feel like cooking!
Worked out great! Maybe should have drained the ricotta a little longer as I found I needed more flour. Made homemade Alfredo and scallops/shrimp with dish!
Fantastic. No complaints. Made as directed.
I’ve made these dozens of times now. They are superb! Easy to make, deliciously delicate. They make me wonder why I ever made them with potatoes.

Oh my, this is good! Fantastic recipe, do not change a thing! 10 stars! make allot and freeze them. I use a vacuum sealer so they are good for about six months. Really fresh and authentic ingredients add to the flavor. Fresh, fresh, fresh!
I baked gnocchi after prep with parm. cheese on top.
Turned out great! I drained the ricotta as recommended.
The gnocchi were little heavenly puffs and easy to make. It is a delightful dish.
Fantastic recipe
Great recipe! Nearly the same as my Dad's recipe that be got from my grandmother. She came over from Italy in the 1890's. I use this basic recipe but add 1/4 tsp of ground nutmeg.
Loved this - very easy to make - a keeper for sure

Made a half portion of the gnocchi since it's just for me. Very easy and so delicious! Didn't even take the time to drain the ricotta (forgot) and they still turned out so soft and tender. Just needed a bit of extra flour to get the right doigh consistency. 
Added to my favorites to reference again and again. Thank you!

My first time making gnocchi. I will make a few adjustments next time. Cut the pepper in half. Boil the gnocchi longer because they didn’t taste quite cooked. I might try canned pasta sauce next time.

I have never made gnocchi before. I was worried because my husband loves his mother’s gnocchi. This really was easy. I served the gnocchi with a bolognese that I had in the freezer. They can out delicious. And my husband thought they were light and fluffy which is exactly what you want. Thank you.
We loved this! My four year old and husband couldn’t get enough.
So easy and much better than potato versions.
These were good, not as pillowy and soft as I hoped.
I would use a little less garlic, but that is a personal opinion. I loved it! it was my first time making gnocchi, and it was amazing my family was in awe of it (:

I was a little nervous about making this because I’m not a great cook but this was pretty easy. I had to add more flour because the dough was too sticky. I thought the sauce was way too cheesy. Even though it said to wait until the cheese got soft and not melted, but the tine it was on the table, it had melted and made it difficult to dish out because of the cheese. I would definitely make it again.
Very good! Light & fluffy! Delicious!!!

I followed the directions exactly. I didn't like the garlic powder in this recipe. That's all I could taste. no one in my family really liked it either. I would make it again without garlic salt, use fresh roma tomatoes instead of canned and add the cheese after plated. The cheese ended up in one big glob.
Made the gnocchi just as written, but used jarred sauce for simplicity. Delicious! Gnocchi are quite sturdy. They don’t turn to mush & fall apart like potato gnocchi.
Made it exactly as written, so good! My kids loved it. I will definitely be making this again.

I’ve been making ricotta gnocchi for years and have had great success, but I usually wing it. This recipe provides good guidelines for amounts of ingredients. I don’t use the Parmesan, reduce the salt, and add parsley flakes to the mix.
The best suggestion I have is to make a large batch (I do 4 times this recipe in one sitting). Lay the gnocchi out on well floured cookie sheets, and freeze. Once frozen, it’s easy to bag it and store in freezer.

Easy and delicious for a meatless Monday meal. Boiled the gnocchi in some salted water . Left out the red pepper flakes and mozzarella cheese because I didn't feel the need for them in the recipe, added a extra can of the diced tomatoes, a pinch of sugar to offset the acidity of the tomatoes and added a bit of the cooking water to the sauce before add the gnocchi .

Make sure you use Raw milk if possible because you will boil it so it’s safe. Not not use store bought milk if possible 
The milk I used was whole milk so I got a very creamy ricotta 
Made the best Manicotti!

Easy to make and a delicious option instead of making potato-based gnocchi. Much easier to work with and flawless in execution. Our gnocchi connoisseur guests had no idea it was only flour based.

Leave out the garlic salt. It is unnecessary and an additive that overwhelms the gnocchi. Garlic and onion salts are not nutritious. 

More important, your sauce should showcase the gnocchi not fight with it.

Double this recipe to serve 4-6 people.
I always made potato gnocchi, which I really liked, but now that I have made ricotta gnocchi, I won’t go back. These are so delicious and easy to make, a great recipe!
I always made potato gnocchi, which I really liked, but now that I have made ricotta gnocchi, I won’t go back. These are so delicious and easy to make, a great recipe!

I can finally make gnocchi. I've tried it twice with potatoes and gave up. Decided to try once more with ricotta. The only change I made was a 15oz ricotta but that's because I wasn't paying attention and it didn't look like 15oz. Increased the flour by 1/2 cup to account for the ricotta. Otherwise, it was great. I froze what I didn't use the same night. Just had some tonight in the Italian Sausage and Ricotta Soup recipe from this sight.
So easy and it turned out so amazing! I needed quite a bit of extra flour though
This is my go to for gnocchi. So light and fluffy.

Delicious! Such simple ingredients made plenty of pasta! The rolling out of the dough was pretty laborious, but for the amount it yielded and the yummy end result, it was worth it! I definitely would make this again (and again) and can see it being a go-to recipe!
Delicious and easy

I made the recipe for the gnocchi exactly as written minus the garlic. I needed to add about a half cup more of flour than it called for to be able to roll them out. They cooked about 4 minutes. They are very tasty and easy to make. I didn't make the sauce as I am using a pesto with them.

I added a lot more flour to the dough so I could handle it. For the sauce I just used a can of Barilla garlic and added the mozzarella. It was really good, but the gnocchi needs to be hot for it to test best.
Great recipe, thank you. Made no changes & perfect results. Like others, I made my own marinara. You should give this a try.
I made this recipe and we all loved it.

Easy and wonderful! Little pillows of pasta with a great fresh sauce. You don't need to handle it much. Roll in pieces and cut, press the tines of the fork into the pieces and if you would like to save for a couple of hours, put on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and cover with plastic wrap. Make sure you have plenty of boiling water. Done when they rise to the surface.
Delicious flavor. Needed to cook them 3-4 minutes in water. Used my own sauce.
My husband really liked them and my kids thought they were good enough to do again.
This was fantastic! I'd never made homemade gnocchi before and I was afraid it would be hard, but they turned out beautifully! I had guests over and they loved it, too.

I bought the fresh Gnocchi from Costco, but used the recipe for the sauce. I added some mushrooms, cooking them in the pan before preparing the sauce. (Taking them out of the pan before pouring the oil in, and then adding them back into the sauce after the tomatoes go in.)

Was going to try a pesto sauce but saw this recipe and how hearty it was - loved it. i always put a little sauce on my pasta so it doesn't stick before serving. but also looks better - not so bald/stark white. 
Yummy dish, you can't mess this up. It was so easy to make!

I have made these a few of times and they have turned out so nice! I follow the recipe because I never had made gnocchi, other than this. I make my own sauce with great success using a variety of flavors...marinara, pesto or a sage butter... Even using skim ricotta this seems like a heavy meal, so I don't do it often. But yes, I will make it again!
The Gnocchi (Cavatelli) came out great! I used my own home made sauce recipe, however, so I cannot speak to this sauce recipe.
Great flavor, but I had about half as much sauce as I wanted.

These gnocchi were STELLAR. I'm knocking off one star for the fresh mozzarella in the sauce. It tasted great, but it made for very difficult eating. Next time I would leave that out or replace it with parm or something.
I will make this again and again. Easy to make and an excellent outcome, my husband is Italian and he loved it! I served it with my homemade sauce and shredded mozzarella.
I thought this was a delightful dinner, much better than plan old spaghetti. I just added a little sugar to the sauce.
Pretty good base recipe.i added Romano cheese in the gnocchi. And a few seasonings to the sauce

This was super. I doubled the ricotta and spices. And added a small amount more of flour. The sauce was nice but turned very bitter from the garlic. I added a tbs of sugar and fixed it. That fresh cheese makes a nice addition. I’ll make it again.

I added a few more chili flakes to give it a little more kick and also a little more parmigiano. This recipe is awesome and a lot easier to make than gnocchi with potatoes. I've made it numerous times an everyone loves it.
Absolutely delightful.

The Ricotta Gnocchi Recipe was very tasty, my family loved it. This is a dish that my mother made when I was a child in Sicily. It is enjoyed by many of the working class people of southern Italy and Sicily. I like it better than the Potato Gnocchi which the rich people in Roma and Milan eat.

Absolutely delicious! I made no changes to the gnocchi, and I used sauce from a jar since that’s what I had on hand. The gnocchi were flavorful and had great texture — and were SO much easier and quicker to make than the potato version. This will be my go-to gnocchi recipe.
I’ve made these many times and always get compliments!

This was my first time endeavoring to make gnocchi, and I'm pretty happy I tried. Unfortunately, I ran out of white flour and had to use wheat flour, which gave the gnocchi a very, almost overwhelming, grainy flavor. I still enjoyed the meal, especially because the super simple sauce is AMAZING! I will certainly try this again and be more careful next time to have all the ingredients I need! The balance of cheese and garlic is perfect!

I used a jarred sauce instead of the one provided in the recipe for ease so my review is specific to the gnocchi (actually gnudi is the correct name according to my research). The gnocchi would be five stars if it wasn’t so dense. I don’t know if its something I did wrong or just how its supposed to be but my wife, who love gnocchi and eats it every chance she has, saw that as the only negative.

I enjoyed this, but I don't think I'd make it again. I ended up using a lot more flour than it called for, and even after several extra cups the dough was still very sticky. They tasted fine, just not my favorite.
I did not make the sauce as I needed the gnocchi for a different recipe. The gnocchi is good though!
I did not make the sauce as I needed the gnocchi for a different recipe. The gnocchi is good though!
Okay. The consistency didn't end up right for me. My husband liked it, though.

I made the recipe almost as is and it was delicious. The only change I made was a use a bigger can of tomatoes and more mozzerella cheese. It was fairly easy to make and it came out great! This is even easy enough to make as a weeknight meal ( I made it on a Wednesday after working all day).
This is delicious. I recommend doubling the sauce recipe, as the sauce is amazing and it could have used a little more!

This was delicious I added some fresh garlic to the Gnocchi and used my own homemade sauce. I found the Gnocchi a little soft for rolling but chose not to add any extra flour because I wanted the ricotta to shine. My family really enjoyed.
This was my first time making any type of pasta, and it was super easy! Kind of taste like tortellini
This was very good and easy to make! It is very filling but I wish I would have made two batches though. We did not make any sides and for a family of 4 the dishes were very small.

So easy to make! Thanks for the recipe! I love the texture of these gnocchi, it has a nice "bounce" to them instead of a soft, chewy texture. Paired well with a meat sauce instead of the sauce above to cut out some of the cheese.
So easy. So delicious. Thanks!!!
Amazing. The gnocchi are so soft and light you cannot buy gnocchi like this. Well worth the effort. The mix easily and roll easily.
Gnocchis were amazing! Pretty easy to make, and the flavor was terrific. We didn't care for the sauce at all, though. Really salty. Next time, I'll use my own sauce.
Delicious and easy. Slightly on the spicy/acidic side!! Keep in mind for what you pair with it (wine or salad dressing)
I made just the gnocchi then my own marinara sauce and it was amazing. Everyone loved it. I highly reccomend

This was my first time making gnocchi and it was actually really good! I followed the recipe but ended up needing more flour - a lot more! Like at least double what was in the recipe. I'm not sure if I did something wrong but it was really frustrating. I kept adding more and more flour and the dough was still sticking to my fingers. I almost gave us and threw everything out but I didn't have a back up plan for dinner lol. I was expecting it to taste terrible and extra heavy because of all the extra flour but it was actually quite delicious. If I do make this again I may use a stand mixer for the dough to make things a little easier.

*** I have made this recipe twice now. The first time I used shredded parmesan cheese and the second time I used grated like the recipe calls for. I found the shredded parmesan cheese made the gnocchi more cheesy and delicious.
It was great! I added thinly sliced portuguese sausage.

Texture of the gnocchi was good with a firm bite yet not too dense or heavy. Tomato sauce was fine but I might try one of my own light sauces with it. Altogether it is a recipe I would keep for based on the texture and flavor of the dumplings.
One of the best things I've ever cooked, but it does take a lot of hands-on time. My only suggestion is to double or triple the recipe, as there are never enough leftovers.
Very tasty - everyone liked it! I added some extra Classico tomato and basil pasta sauce that we had in the fridge to the sauce and used fresh tomatoes - very tasty and easy to make.
Just AWSOME this is a keeper

This was absolutely fantastic. It was my first time making Gnocchi, and this is just made it all the more simple. I found that I had to add quite a bit more flour to form the right dough consistency, but other than that it was spot-on. All I really did was strain the Gnocchi, sear it off in a pan with some butter/olive oil to give it some nice color, then I mixed it in with the sauce, added cheese, and popped it in the broiler. Out came a nice, golden, plate of gnocchi. Great recipe. Good job.
I had bought some gnocchi from the grocery store so I made this sauce to go with it. It was amazing! Next time I will try making the entire recipe from scratch. :)

This is the second gnocchi recipe I have made. I didn't use the sauce, so I can't rate that one way or the other, but it sounds great! I used a spinach basil pesto recipe I also found on allrecipes which was delicious. The only thing I changed with the gnocchi was the cooking time. My only other experience with making gnocchi, the directions said to cook for 4-5 minutes. Those turned out well, so I decided to split the difference and cook these for 3 minutes, and they turned out great.
This recipe is SUPER easy, and very delish. I double the sauce recipe every time, but keep the mozzarella the same, and triple the basil because it's my favorite!
I followed the recipe as written, except for the pepper flakes; and it was AWESOME! This will be in our regular rotation from now on.
My husband and I LOVED this!!! I added a bit more crushed red pepper and it was just a little spicy and perfect; Very very good and easy!

Easy and delicious. I used a food processor and just pulsed it. Super fast and fun. I also roll my gnocchi on the bottom of a special bread basket my mom brought me back from Italy. It's how she use to do it when we were growing up. It gives the gnocchi nooks and crannies for the sauce, yum! I only made the gnocchi since I already had some of my own home made sauce.

I'm not quite sure I'm a fan of gnocchi in general, but these were easy to make and tasted pretty good! Next time I'll leave out the pepper, as I didn't like it in the gnocchi (I do like pepper, though - weird!) I did find that they really need to soak up some sauce, whatever kind you choose to serve with it, to be palatable. I served half with a mushroom, spinach, garlic white wine sauce, and I'm having the rest with my own marinara. I will make these again, as it's nice to have a different type of "pasta" once in a while.
Sooooo delicious!!!!! Much easier than anticipated!
I prefer potato gnocchi as it is lighter but this is a nice change and the sauce is good especially if you substitute fresh sweet pepper for the dried flakes which are suggested in the recipe.

Delicious. I bought fresh Ricotta from our Italian market and exactly 1 pound was perfect. I also use semolina flour as it gives a golden color and more authentic taste. Omit the garlic powder; it is not necessary at all. Boiling is my preferred method of cooking. So good with vodka sauce or pesto.
Very easy, and so yummy!
Delicious, my wife and I absolutely loved this recipe, quick, easy and good how can you go wrong?
I made this exactly as suggested. It is DELISH! My husband requests this all of the time.
Easy to follow recipe, authentic taste.

I've never made gnocchi before and I followed this recipe exactly. I really loved them and so did my family and husband who is always leery about something new. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because there wasn't enough sauce. After the sauce was done cooking, there wasn't much there so I dumped about 8oz of tomato sauce in and added some basil and oregano and cooked it a bit longer. Even still there really wasn't enough sauce for everyone to their liking. I would definitely double the sauce recipe in the future. Also, I'm a cheese lover - and one of those who never can get enough cheese, but I didn't even put all the mozzarella cubes in the sauce because there were so many.

Thank you for this great recipe so much less work then potato gnocchi and so tasty I always serve my gnocchi with sage butter and some fresh Parmesan cheese perfect summer dinner with some gazpacho as appetizer

This is a great recipe. My only tip is in adding the gnocchi to the boiling water. I wanted to add all of the gnocchi at the same time so they would all be done at the same time. So, what I do is place the gnocchi on parchment paper. I then roll up the parchment (very loosely so you don't crush the gnocchi) and lower into the boiling water, holding one edge of the parchment so you don't scald your fingers. They release immediately, and just pull the parchment out of the water. Don't use wax paper because some of the wax will end up in the water and the paper tends to shred. Works every time!
